recipes.name: Masor Tenga
instructions: Marinate fish pieces with salt and turmeric. Keep aside for 15 minutes.
Heat mustard oil in a pan and fry the fish till golden brown.
In the same oil, add chopped ginger and garlic, then sauté chopped tomatoes till soft.
Add a little water and bring it to boil. Add the fried fish.
Squeeze lemon juice and adjust salt. Cook for a few minutes.
Garnish with green chilies and coriander leaves. Serve hot with rice.

recipes.name: Aloo Pitika
instructions: Mash boiled potatoes in a bowl.
Add finely chopped onions, green chilies, and coriander leaves.
Drizzle mustard oil and add salt to taste.
Mix well until evenly combined.
Serve as a side dish with rice and dal.

recipes.name: Khar
ingredients: Khar (alkaline water made from banana peel ash)
instructions: Peel and slice raw papaya into thin pieces.
Heat mustard oil in a pan and sauté the papaya for 5 minutes.
Add khar and a little water. Cook until papaya becomes soft.
Add salt and mix well. Simmer for a few more minutes.
Serve hot with steamed rice.

recipes.name: Pitika of Bilahi (Tomato Pitika)
instructions: Roast tomatoes over an open flame or bake until soft.
Peel off the skin and mash in a bowl.
Add chopped onions, green chilies, and mustard oil.
Add salt to taste and mix well.
Serve as a side dish with rice.

recipes.name: Ou Tenga Dail
instructions: Cook dal with turmeric and salt until soft.
Boil chopped elephant apple separately and add to the dal.
Heat mustard oil, splutter mustard seeds and red chili for tempering.
Pour tempering over the dal and simmer for a few minutes.
Serve hot with rice.

recipes.name: Pani Tenga
instructions: Boil water with salt and chopped green chilies.
Add sour greens or lemon juice.
Temper with mustard seeds in hot oil.
Add tempering to the water mixture.
Serve as a soup or palate cleanser.

recipes.name: Bora Saulor Payas
instructions: Wash and soak bora saul for 30 minutes.
Boil milk and add the soaked rice.
Cook on low flame until the rice is soft and the milk thickens.
Add sugar, cardamom, and bay leaf. Stir well.
Add fried cashews and raisins. Serve warm or chilled.

recipes.name: Duck Curry with Kumura
instructions: Marinate duck pieces with spices and salt.
Heat mustard oil and sauté chopped onions until golden.
Add ginger-garlic paste and cook until raw smell disappears.
Add duck meat and cook until browned.
Add kumura pieces and cook until both duck and gourd are soft.
Serve hot with rice.

recipes.name: Poita Bhat
instructions: Soak cooked rice overnight in water.
Drain and mash lightly in the morning.
Add chopped onions, green chilies, mustard oil, and salt.
Mix well and serve with mashed potatoes or chutney.

recipes.name: Thekera Tenga
instructions: Soak thekera in warm water until it softens.
Boil in water with salt and a bit of sugar if needed.
Simmer until thekera releases its sourness.
Serve as a tangy side dish or palate cleanser.
